title: So anyone has a solution for RADS error?

embed.description: Ever since this morning where I had a RADS Error I haven't been able to get onto the game today, after researching I managed to fix that error but...

body:
I was just thinking, "hey why don't I open up league and hopefully find some fun there?" BAAAM RADS ERROR GIT GUD LOLOLOLOLOLOL

Alright then, :(

Before you judge me as one of the whiners I did attempted a search and trying to find a solution on my own, I now have an Idea on how to fix it but due to my lack the limited exposure to internet architectures and what not I have trouble locating the final piece.

As you can see above that is a reddit page of RADS error solution when it seems to had been plaguing the EUW server some time ago.

To fix it would seem that we need to change our DNS server to Google's (or someone else more reliable, in this case, google) because the original DNS server (is that you Microsoft????? I hope it isn't you) failed to update the details with League, leading to errors, if my poor interpretation hasn't gotten in my way this time.

The problem I have is though, that is for EUW,** is the Google's DNS here the same as the one used in EUW?** I don't wanna randomly update my DNS to some random service I don't even know.

replies.body:
1. Right click on your connection icon in the bottom right of your screen.
2. Go to the network centre. 
3. Go to the adapter settings thingie.
4. Search your connection.
5. Right click -> properties.
6. Search Internet protocol version 4.
7. Right click -> properties.
8. Change your DNS servers to 8.8.4.4 (the first one) and 8.8.8.8 (the second one).

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=V05eENZd,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-01-14T00:44:35.086+0000)
> 
> The problem I have is though, that is for EUW,** is the Google's DNS here the same as the one used in EUW?** I don't wanna randomly update my DNS to some random service I don't even know.


Go to the EUW Boards not the OCE ones

Why are people spamming the boards?

ugh

anyway, Google's Public DNS is just a tool used to fetch names for your computer. It's isn't really location specific, I believe Google have servers all over the globe. You should try connecting to it.
La lala lala lalla la la la no 1 bother to reply people who are having problem seems like later we all will quit the game la lala 5th day no play :/
